title: What was your first smartphone? When did you buy it? - Quora

response.answer_text: My first ever smartphone was the Samsung Galaxy trend 2 GT S7392 which I had bought for INR 6499. I bought it in January of 2014. Used it till March of 2016 after which I discontinued using it. It had 512mb RAM and 4GB of internal space. It was a 4 inch TFT display screen with WiFi and 3G.  I had exactly the same black variant. As far as performance was concerned, I had a hard time using it since it use to freeze and crash quite often. Also it used to heat up a lot when I used mobile data and drain it's battery. Oh and I could not take selfies as it lacked front camera. Still, I was a school student and having a smartphone was a big deal. The phone was very sturdy and never had a dent on it's screen.Moreover I used 3G data on it as well. Sometimes I do miss that phone though..all those endless group chats I used to have on WhatsApp with my school friends, copying important stuff for school and watching movies or playing songs while traveling. I have so many memories with that phone.

Mine was a Moto Q. My company realized it would be cheaper to give us these instead of 2 way pagers. It was horrible. It did email fine but nothing else. The camera couldn't take a good picture, its browser couldn't display common web pages and even Solitaire was awkward to play on it. Years later my first iPhone was worlds better.

I think it should be the Nokia N97i. Though I got my Blackberry 8820 prior to the N97i but I never really used software related to a smartphone platform. And my phones in order. Blackberry 8820Nokia N97iSony Ericsson MK16iBlackberry Bold 9780Sony Z1Blackberry Q10Sony Z UltraSony Z5 CompactBlackberry ClassicSony XZ1 (Current Phone)From middle school to college. Lol

LG Spirit - one of the worst things. The camera was awful, I had barely any storage, and it kept deleting my messages. The only thing I liked about it was my ringtone: Ring ring Ring ring Ring ring Pick up your phone Ring ring Ring ring Ring ring Pick up your phone Ring ring (ring ring) (Multiple voices) Pick up your phone! It sung that basically as a pop so with backing vocals and different vocal ranges and it was the best thing ever, except for one time when me and my friend and her brother were all walking to school and she was trying to get him to go home cause he was ill and it was a very serious conversation and my phone went off because my grandma was calling me

Mine is Lumia 530…. Windows phone… bought in 2013… no hanging, no lags, no heating issues, even asphalt 8 (1gb) plays gud without any lags…. Still I have it….. unlike Android,the worst thing in Windows phone is u won't get lot of useful apps …… and sometimes if an errorcode is displayed, u have to reset ur phone….. rest all gud…

I dont remember it's model no. exactly. It was Xolo phone. I bought it in 2014. Priced around 5000, it had 4gb internal storage, 512mb RAM, 5mp rear camera and no front camera. It was running on android jellybean out of the box and was energised by Mediatek processor with 4 cores. Sadly I lost it, but it was a good phone for average user as it hardly had any issues.

2013 IPHONE 4’S IT WAS SECOND HAND BUT WAS QUITE POPULAR THOSE DAYS. I USED TO USE NOKIA BEFORE (NOT SMARTPHONE). THEN I HEARD ABOUT APPLE . AND I THOUGHT A SYMBOL OF RICHNESS IS WHAT I NEED TO SHOW PEOPLE. THEN I BOUGHT IT . IT TOOK ME 2 MONTHS TO LEARN THE BASIC FEATURES OF THAT PHONE AND SINCE THEN I CHANGED 4 SMARTPHONES AND I AM PRETTY SURE THAT I MADE A GOOD CHOICE BUYING IPHONE . AS I LEARNED ABOUT THE FUTURE AT THAT TIME (IT WAS LIKE FUTURE AS I WAS USING NOKIA).

The first phone that I ever got to use properly was a…. you guessed it…. A Nokia 2700 classic, or 2700c for short.  Man that thing was a beast of a machine. Even now after using so many different smartphones and what not, I still like it. Sadly, mine got lost somewhere or else I would have still had it, least as a memory piece. Cheers - H

A Palm Centro circa 2007 that I got from AT&T Wireless. I really liked the external mechanical keyboard and the ability to sync with my Palm PDA contacts. Then Android came out and I started migrating to those phones. Palm Centro - Wikipedia

Nearly in the year 2014, I got Redmi 1s of Xiaomi. This was my first ever Smart Phone. That time it was exclusively available on Flipkart only. There was first ever sale for this particular phone. Even after getting it booked, it delivered to me after almost 20 days of wait.  Image Source : Google
My first ever smartphone was the Metro PCS BlackBerry Curve 8330m in 2009. The phone had some nice features, but Metro’s shitty network made it unusable.
Long as long as you back them up to the cloud or make sure you keep your old phone you can Bluetooth them to your new phone or you can storm on your SD card
